lines.text:
[repeated]
Love is the morning and the evening star.
Sin, sin, sin! You're all sinners! You're all doomed to perdition!
That's the trouble with this stinking world. Nobody loves nobody.
lines.character: Lady in red on Christmas Eve

lines.text: Oh, he gave me special instructions back of the pulpit Christmas Eve. He got to howlin' "Repent! Repent!" and I got to moanin' "Save me! Save me!" and the first thing I know he rammed the fear of God into me so fast I never heard my old man's footsteps!
But tonight is a thousand years away.
Besides, I'm for a free press, for free enterprise... and for whatever the hell the other freedoms are!
French postcards. They were sold to me in front of your own innocent high school by a man with a black beard... a foreigner.

Mister, I've been converted five times. Billy Sunday, Reverend Biederwolf, Gypsy Smith, and twice by Sister Falconer. I get terrible drunk, and then I get good and saved. Both of them done me a powerful lot of good - gettin' drunk and gettin' saved. Well, good night.
I was accosted by three painted women. Your streets are made unsafe by shameless, diseased hussies, rapacious pick-pockets, and insidious opium-smokers.
You look like a man who could use a drink.
You know somethin', Jim? There oughta be a law against drinkin'.
